text: Metagenes () was an Athenian comic poet of the Old Comedy, contemporary with Aristophanes, Phrynichus, and Plato.Scholiast on Aristophanes Av. 1297 The Suda gives the following titles of his plays: Αὖραι, Μαμμάκυθος, Θουριοπέρσαι, Φιλοθύτης, Ὅμηρος ἢ Ἀσκηταί, some of which appear to be corrupt.August Meineke, Trag. Coin. Graec. vol. i. pp. 218-221, vol. ii. pp. 751-760Theodor Bergk, Com. Att. Ant. Reliq. p. 421Johann Albert Fabricius, Bibliotheca Graeca vol. ii. p. 470 ==References== Category:4th-century BC Athenians Category:4th- century BC writers Category:5th-century BC Athenians Category:5th-century BC writers Category:Ancient Athenians Category:Ancient Greek dramatists and playwrights Category:Old Comic poets
title: Metagenes (poet)
